content: Can you tell me how to Prepare For The Next Four Years?

To prepare for the next four years, you should read history, psychology and biographies. Go for information that has a long half-life, not something that's going to be contradicted.

Get up, go to work, pay taxes, eat three meals and maybe some snacks in between, walk/run a mile a day, lift once a day, drink a gallon of water or so a day.

Show up regularly, ask smart questions, and do the work. If you do that, opportunities to lead or real gaps to fill will reveal themselves.

Getting through the next four years, minimizing the damage while taking the wins we can get, is going to take calm and discipline.
